title: Short sale and second mortgage 1099c ? reportable or not?
question: i have a home that i owe 160000 for first and 28000 on second first with wells fargo second with boa we are short selling for 92500 i got my second four years later as fixed equity loan and bought a car with it would i still get 1099c on it is that reportable income would i owe taxes on it also 3 years later i sold the car for 16000 and put that in my savings how would that work out money is not in my savings now as i have already spent it.thanks plz answer each question
answers:
Issuance of the 1099-C is dependent upon the bank deciding to forgive the debt and foregoing pursuing the deficiency balance after the sale. If the bank does issue a 1099-C, then the debt forgiven on your principal residence is generally eligible for exclusion both federally and with the state. However, because you used debt taken out to pay personal expenses (i.e., purchasing a car), that amount will not be eligible because it was not reinvested into your principal residence. What you sold the car for should not impact this. You should meet with a tax advisor upon getting a 1099-C.

You will receive a 1099C for the cancellation of the debt. The question is whether it is taxable. This should not be taxable if this is your principal residence. For Federal tax purposes you are allowed $2.5 Million of debt relief on a principal residence before it is taxable.
